intro: Mesophlebion caroli, commonly known as the Carolinian mesophlebion, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its reproductive cycle is closely tied to seasonal changes, with flowering typically occurring in late spring. Due to habitat loss, Mesophlebion caroli is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
